roleset.name: throw, sending through the air, manually, projection of an object through space
roleset.note: THROW-V NOTES: Member of Vncls throw-17.1-1-1. Comparison to 'cast'. (from throw.01-v)
THROWING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-5, throw-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls throw-17.1-1-1. (from throwing.01-n)
THROW-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on throw-v.01. Corresponds to Vncls throw-17.1-1-1. (from throw.01-n)

example.name: idiom: throw in the towel
example.text: [Thermo Electron]-1 acquired some 6% of Milton Roy's common stock before *trace*-1 throwing in the towel and reducing its stake in early September.

example.name: throw into doubt
example.text: In the wake of Campeau's problems, prices of junk bonds tumbled, *trace* throwing into doubt the ability of corporate acquirers to finance large takeovers with the help of junk bond sales.
example.arg: the ability of corporate acquirers to finance large takeovers with the help of junk bond sales

example.name: another direction
example.text: ``[Stocks]-1 were being thrown *trace*-1 out of windows at any price.''

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: Welfare and other mechanisms of redistribution under capitalism are little more than the throwing of crumbs at the many who otherwise suffer the worst effects of its alienation and exploitation .
example.arg: at the many who otherwise suffer the worst effects of its alienation and exploitation

example.name: with EXT
example.text: With a throw of 57.28 meters , Chiang shattered the world record for the javelin in the F12 visually - impaired class .

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: His throw of the dice was unsuccessful.

roleset.name: hold
roleset.note: THROW-V NOTES: Frames file for 'throw' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. (from throw.03-v predicate notes)

example.name: throw a party
example.text: In an invention that drives Verdi purists bananas, Violetta lies dying in bed during the prelude, rising deliriously when then she remembers the great parties [0]-3 [she]-2 used *trace-2* to throw *trace-3*.

roleset.name: toss, get rid of
roleset.note: THROW_AWAY-V NOTES: Frame created by Jena (from throw.07-v)

role.descr: theme, thing being included in some group

example.name: and a set of Ginsu knives
example.text: *trace* Throw in its railroad, minerals, pipeline and oil assets, he and others argued, and the Chicago-based conglomerate should be worth 30 a share.
example.arg: its railroad, minerals, pipeline and oil assets

roleset.name: say
roleset.note: THROW_OUT-V NOTES: Frame edited by Arrick (from throw.04-v)

example.name: Transitive
example.text: Every once in a while someone will throw out a gentlemanly "Can you make it a little cheaper?" as they are handing me their money.
example.arg: a gentlemanly "Can you make it a little cheaper?;
as they hand me their money

roleset.name: toss, get rid of
roleset.note: THROW_OUT-V NOTES: Frame created by Jena (from throw.06-v)

example.name: Transitive
example.text: ...a year's worth of food that-2 we-3 may end up *-3 throwing *T*-2 out.
example.arg: that-2 -> a year's worth of food

roleset.name: puke with object
roleset.note: THROW_UP-V NOTES: Predicate added by Arrick. VN, FN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls breathe-40.1.2. (from throw.05-v)

example.name: if it isn't steriods it's something else...
example.text: [*PRO*-2]-1 Overcome *-1 by hunger pains [Sellers]-2 would eat massive amounts of food and then throw it up *PRO*-2 to make weight.
